ai.summary: A challenging 15.7 km hard hike on a UK multi-use trail. Expect a mix of terrain, notable elevation, and potentially muddy ground; designed for experienced walkers with good fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of firm gravel and paved sections, muddy tracks, and rocky steps. You may encounter steep ascents and descents, uneven surfaces, and exposed stretches where wind can be strong. In wet weather, surfaces can become slippery.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard hike: plan for the full distance and daylight. Check the weather forecast and be prepared for sudden changes. Wear sturdy boots with good ankle support and waterproof clothing. Bring enough water and high-energy snacks. Carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a charged phone. Stay on marked paths, and tell someone your route and expected return time. Pack a small first aid kit, emergency whistle, and spare socks. Consider trekking poles for stability and added support on rough or steep sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves as needed)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and emergency contacts
Lightweight rain cover for your backpack
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (late March to October), with best conditions in late spring and summer; winter hikes can be challenging due to mud, reduced daylight, and wind exposure.
